title: Elastic Collision - Kinetic energies of blocks

content.description: Two identical blocks, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are sliding across a horizontal surface. Friction between the surface and the blocks is negligible. Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </math> is initially traveling to the right with speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is initially traveling to the left with speed <math alttext="2 v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown. At time <math alttext="t equals t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the blocks undergo an elastic collision.
content.question: Which of the following pairs of graphs could represent the kinetic energies <math alttext="K sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="K sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> of blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, respectively, as functions of time?

choices.label: The figure shows two graphs, each with three connected line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of their respective coordinate planes, each with the origin labeled O. In each graph, the horizontal axis is labeled t, and the value t sub 1 is indicated in the middle of the axis. The vertical axis is labeled K sub A in one graph and is labeled K sub B in the other graph. The graph with the K sub A vertical axis shows a line that begins on the vertical axis 1 unit above the origin, moves horizontally to the right to coordinates t sub 1 comma 1, moves vertically upward 3 units to coordinates t sub 1 comma 4, and then moves horizontally to the right. The graph with the K sub B vertical axis shows a line that begins on the vertical axis 4 units above the origin, moves horizontally to the right to coordinates t sub 1 comma 4, moves vertically downward 3 units to coordinates t sub 1 comma 1, and then moves horizontally to the right.
